thread.title: Area Roundup: Morris boys, girls each win Ross Greiter Invite
thread.title_full: Area Roundup: Morris boys, girls each win Ross Greiter Invite

title: Area Roundup: Morris boys, girls each win Ross Greiter Invite
text:
Area Roundup: Morris boys, girls each win Ross Greiter Invite Published: Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015 10:00 p.m. CDT • Updated: Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015 10:35 p.m. CDT By: STAFF REPORTS 
PLANO – Both the Morris boys and girls cross country teams continued their successful seasons Tuesday, as both took first place at the Ross Greiter Invitational. Related Links Area Roundup: Morris boys, girls each win Ross Greiter Invite 
The boys finished the nine-team race with 26 points, ahead of Yorkville (68), Sandwich (88), Westmont (116) and Seneca (156). Zach Chapman was the top finisher for Morris, taking second on the 3-mile course with a time of 16:45.8. Zach Guzman finished fourth in 16:58.9, while Al Alvarez was fifth in 17:05.9. Jordan Olson took seventh with a time of 17:07.9, while Max Dudley was 13th in 17:42.1. 
For Seneca, Christopher Collet was the top finisher, taking third in 16:48.2, followed by Zach Rivett (28th, 18:57.6), Kole Gallick (38th, 19:49.1), Joey Thomas (43rd, 20:17.1) and Calvin Wilson (56th, 21:43.5). 
In the girls race, Morris finished first among seven teams with 50 points, while Seneca was second with 56. 
The Redskins’ top runner was Mya Shannon, who took third in 20:00. The next three Morris runners finished within a half-second of each other as Madi Mayberry was 11th in 21:17.9, Meghan Smith was 12th in 21:18.2 and Bridget Landers was 13th in 21:18.4. Sabrina Baftiri was 15th with a time of 21:19.8. 
For Seneca, Eva Bruno finished second overall with a time of 19:05.5, followed by Sarah Virgo (6th, 20:04.2), Carina Collet (8th, 20:43.4), Sarah Cameron (17th, 21:25.7) and Emily Misener (27th, 22:28.8). 
VOLLEYBALL 
Seneca 25-25, Dwight 12-20: Emily Woods had six kills, seven assists, four service points and two blocks to lead the Irish (12-11-1) to the nonconference win. Claudia Paulson had five kills and five blocks, Emily Hauch had seven blocks and Karlie Cade had eight assists. 
Beecher 25-25, Gardner-South Wilmington 13-15: Lexi Robison led the Panthers (13-5, 5-3) with six kills in a River Valley Conference loss, while Kaylee Steichen added three kills. Sydney Perkins distributed seven assists and Celia Barna had four, while Jenni Price led with 11 digs. 
BOYS SOCCER 
Plainfield Central 2, Minooka 1: Kyle Sparks scored the only goal for Minooka, off an assist from Austin Wielgosz. Noah Jawdat was in goal for the Indians.
